intro: Iozoste maingayi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, heart-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with a short, thick stem. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The flowers, which come in a range of colors, are pollinated primarily by bees and other small insects.
